      Online Learning                                                                                     Overview                                                                                                                                 The Office of Global and Lifelong Learning offers programs and events in a variety of online synchronous and asynchronous formats, including live, interactive webcasts, blended curriculum, and videotaped lectures on current topics. Facilitated by NYU Silver School of Social Work faculty, our online programs will provide participants with knowledge and skills for continued development and advancement within the field of social work and related areas of health care practice. Additional online learning opportunities for the 2014-15 program year are currently in development and will be posted on this web page as they become available for enrollment.   NYSED-approved Continuing Education Contact Hours will be awarded for all online programs and events. Current online offerings are approved by The Association for Advanced Training in the Behavioral Sciences (AATBS).   Note: Continuing Education Contact Hours are awarded only for CE Programs. Academic Courses do not award Continuing Education Contact Hours.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   CE Hours Programs                                                                                                   Building Family Resilience     Videotaped Lecture Series in 2 parts - Self Study   3 NYSED-approved contact hours (1.5 per part)     Mindfulness in DBT     Videotaped webinar - Self Study   1 NYSED-approved contact hour     Holding on and Letting Go: The Red Thread of Adult Bereavement       Live webinar - April 30, 2015     2 NYSED-approved contact hours       Sexual Addictions in the Digital Age     Live Webinar - May 5, 2015   1.5 NYSED contact hours (pending approval)                                                                                                                                                                                                                Academic Courses                                                                                                   Advanced Clinical Assessment & Diagnosis - HBIII     Asynchronous online course   3 academic credits (CEUs not awarded for course)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Programs and Events                                                                              Certificate Programs                                                                                                        Conferences & Events                                                                                                        Online Learning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            NYSED Approved Provider of Continuing Education Contact Hours             The Silver School of Social Work is recognized by the New York State Education Department's State Board for Social Work as an approved provider of continuing education for licensed social workers #0012.                                                                                                  Learning Assessments for CEU Programs                                                                                                   In order to obtain continuing education contact hours, participants are required to complete a short post-event learning assessment. The learning assessment will be sent out electronically via the e-mail address provided at registration. Upon completion of the learning assessment, the credits will be e-mailed to the participant.                                                                                                                                                                                                            State Exclusions                                                                                                   NOTE: States regulate activity related to distance learning continuing education contact hours and academic course offerings. NYU is currently unable to distribute distance education to the following states:   1. Alabama  2. New Hampshire  3. Oklahoma  4. Texas  5. Wisconsin  6. Alaska  7. Oregon  8. Utah   Until further notice, individuals from the above states are restricted from enrolling in NYU online learning offerings.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Our Faculty                                                                                                   Silver School faculty are creating knowledge for tomorrow and training the next generation of social workers. Our stellar faculty include a leader in qualitative research methods and the president of the National Association of Social Workers. Faculty members are shaping the discourse of the major theoretical and philosophical issues facing the profession, building a cadre of social workers in palliative and end-of-life care, and partnering with agencies and organizations to create effective interventions. LEARN MORE»                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Academics                                                                                                   The Silver School offers outstanding degree programs at the undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral levels. The Bachelor of Science program establishes the foundation graduates need to effectively address the social problems of today’s world. The MSW program offers an integrated curriculum, which weaves together classroom and field experiences, educating students about the pursuit of social justice. Our doctoral program prepares students for a successful career at an academic institution and for leadership roles in design and development of social welfare programs and policies.                                                      Our Faculty                                                                                                   Silver School faculty are creating knowledge for tomorrow and training the next generation of social workers. Our stellar faculty include a leader in qualitative research methods and the president of the National Association of Social Workers. Faculty members are shaping the discourse of the major theoretical and philosophical issues facing the profession, building a cadre of social workers in palliative and end-of-life care, and partnering with agencies and organizations to create effective interventions. LEARN MORE»                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Academics                                                                                                   The Silver School offers outstanding degree programs at the undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral levels. The Bachelor of Science program establishes the foundation graduates need to effectively address the social problems of today’s world. The MSW program offers an integrated curriculum, which weaves together classroom and field experiences, educating students about the pursuit of social justice. Our doctoral program prepares students for a successful career at an academic institution and for leadership roles in design and development of social welfare programs and policies.         Advanced Clinical Assessment and Diagnosis - HBIII                                                                                     Overview                                                                                                       Taught by Associate Professor Judith Siegel , this online course strengthens skills in assessing individuals, with an emphasis on application of the DSM-5 in understanding mental disorders. The course considers the historical perspective of diagnosis and the development as well as the use and limitations of the DSM and ICD. The diagnostic criteria for most of the major mental disorders from childhood through late adulthood are studied from a biopsychosocial perspective that includes neurobiology research. Implications for clinical interventions and specific treatment approaches are considered.   This is an asynchronous course that students take on an individualized basis. Each of the fourteen lessons contains notes, video lectures, and videos of clients. They also contain links to most of the assigned readings from required books and journal articles.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Apply Now                                                                                                            Eligibility                                                                                                       MSW from an accredited MSW program in the United States or Canada.                                                                                                                                                                                                            Credits                                                                                                       Three academic credits will be earned. This course is not eligible for NYSED CEUs.                                                                                                                                                                                                            More Information                                                                                                   Contact:   Associate Professor Judith Siegel   Phone: (212) 998-5949   Email: judith.siegel@nyu.edu     Discounts of up to 25 percent available. Please inquire with the NYU Silver Office of Admissions and Enrollment Services by emailing silver.financialaid@nyu.edu .                                                                                                                                                                                                            State Exclusions                                                                                                   NOTE: States regulate activity related to distance learning continuing education contact hours and academic course offerings. NYU is currently unable to distribute distance education to the following states:   1. Alabama  2. New Hampshire  3. Oklahoma  4. Texas  5. Wisconsin  6. Alaska  7. Oregon  8. Utah   Until further notice, individuals from the above states are restricted from enrolling in NYU online learning offerings.                                                      Our Faculty                                                                                                   Silver School faculty are creating knowledge for tomorrow and training the next generation of social workers. Our stellar faculty include a leader in qualitative research methods and the president of the National Association of Social Workers. Faculty members are shaping the discourse of the major theoretical and philosophical issues facing the profession, building a cadre of social workers in palliative and end-of-life care, and partnering with agencies and organizations to create effective interventions. LEARN MORE»                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   Academics                                                                                                   The Silver School offers outstanding degree programs at the undergraduate, master’s, and doctoral levels. The Bachelor of Science program establishes the foundation graduates need to effectively address the social problems of today’s world. The MSW program offers an integrated curriculum, which weaves together classroom and field experiences, educating students about the pursuit of social justice. Our doctoral program prepares students for a successful career at an academic institution and for leadership roles in design and development of social welfare programs and policies.         Advanced Clinical Assessment and Diagnosis - HBIII                                                                                     Overview                                                                                                       Taught by Associate Professor Judith Siegel , this online course strengthens skills in assessing individuals, with an emphasis on application of the DSM-5 in understanding mental disorders. The course considers the historical perspective of diagnosis and the development as well as the use and limitations of the DSM and ICD. The diagnostic criteria for most of the major mental disorders from childhood through late adulthood are studied from a biopsychosocial perspective that includes neurobiology research. Implications for clinical interventions and specific treatment approaches are considered.   This is an asynchronous course that students take on an individualized basis. Each of the fourteen lessons contains notes, video lectures, and videos of clients. They also contain links to most of the assigned readings from required books and journal articles.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Apply Now                                                                                                            Eligibility                                                                                                       MSW from an accredited MSW program in the United States or Canada.                                                                                                                                                                                                            Credits                                                                                                       Three academic credits will be earned. This course is not eligible for NYSED CEUs.       Online Learning                                                                                     Overview                                                                                                                                 The Office of Global and Lifelong Learning offers programs and events in a variety of online synchronous and asynchronous formats, including live, interactive webcasts, blended curriculum, and videotaped lectures on current topics. Facilitated by NYU Silver School of Social Work faculty, our online programs will provide participants with knowledge and skills for continued development and advancement within the field of social work and related areas of health care practice. Additional online learning opportunities for the 2014-15 program year are currently in development and will be posted on this web page as they become available for enrollment.   NYSED-approved Continuing Education Contact Hours will be awarded for all online programs and events. Current online offerings are approved by The Association for Advanced Training in the Behavioral Sciences (AATBS).   Note: Continuing Education Contact Hours are awarded only for CE Programs. Academic Courses do not award Continuing Education Contact Hours.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   CE Hours Programs                                                                                                   Building Family Resilience     Videotaped Lecture Series in 2 parts - Self Study   3 NYSED-approved contact hours (1.5 per part)     Mindfulness in DBT     Videotaped webinar - Self Study   1 NYSED-approved contact hour     Holding on and Letting Go: The Red Thread of Adult Bereavement       Live webinar - April 30, 2015     2 NYSED-approved contact hours       Sexual Addictions in the Digital Age     Live Webinar - May 5, 2015   1.5 NYSED contact hours (pending approval)                                                                                                                                                                                                                Academic Courses                                                                                                   Advanced Clinical Assessment & Diagnosis - HBIII     Asynchronous online course   3 academic credits (CEUs not awarded for course)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Programs and Events                                                                              Certificate Programs                                                                                                        Conferences & Events                                                                                                        Online Learning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            NYSED Approved Provider of Continuing Education Contact Hours             The Silver School of Social Work is recognized by the New York State Education Department's State Board for Social Work as an approved provider of continuing education for licensed social workers #0012.                                                                                                  Learning Assessments for CEU Programs                                                                                                   In order to obtain continuing education contact hours, participants are required to complete a short post-event learning assessment. The learning assessment will be sent out electronically via the e-mail address provided at registration. Upon completion of the learning assessment, the credits will be e-mailed to the participant.
